title: Look sharp: 13 standout trends from the season’s key collections – in pictures
description: This autumn saw a return to tailoring, elegant eveningwear and elevated casual classics. Here are the top runway looks to inspire your winter wardrobe in our menswear collections story Continue reading...
author: Fashion editor Helen Seamons Photographer Andrew Woffinden
excerpt: This autumn saw a return to tailoring, elegant eveningwear and elevated casual classics. Here are the top runway looks to inspire your winter wardrobe in our menswear collections story
text: Double-breasted jacketSaint Laurent, Gucci, Ralph Lauren and Tom Ford lead the comeback. The once deemed formal style jacket appears with new cuts and a contemporary edge. Pink taupe fluid jacket and trousers, storm shirt with collar and derby shoes all Saint Laurent by Anthony Vaccarello, ysl.com HeritageCountry house dressing is a big trend, from tweed to herringbone and check, spotted as chore jackets at Prada and tailored herringbone coats at Dries Van Noten. Wool suit, blue and white Oxford shirt and silk tie all prada.com Wide-leg trousersWe are all for a lovely pair of trousers, this season the designers went for it in a big way, literally! Dark green jump jacket, double waistband trousers, silk scarf, classic sock and loafers, all givenchy.com WesternFull-look denim was everywhere, at Louis Vuitton appearing as western wear, think runway versions of the Texan Tuxedo. Washed 3D denim jacket, jeans and rider boots, all louisvuitton.com Keep it cosyChoose soft textures in tonal colours to hunker down in on bad weather days. Sweater, gloves, boucle knitted pants, all zegna.com Modern eveningRethink traditional black-tie; ditch the tie and look for interesting details, such as bows and corsages. Bow detail tuxedo, dolceandgabbana.com PreppyFollow Grace Wales Bonner’s lead and mix varsity Americana with Savile Row tailoring for a pulled together sporty inspired look. Crew jumper, linen shirt, trousers, leather bowling bag and mules, all walesbonner.com Weekend casualIf in doubt, navy with nautical styling details is a fashion classic. Hat, scarf, anorak with drawstring hood, wide-leg wool trousers and belt, all Emporio Armani, armani.com Winter shortsShorts are no longer just for spring/summer, embrace the trend with a longer sock and chunky knitwear. Brown leather bomber, grey wool V-neck cardigan, zipped shirts, socks and ballerina strap shoes, all dior.com Contrasting colour Try unexpected colour combos: Dries Van Noten mixed dusty pink with mustard, at Prada, Raf Simons and Miuccia Prada teamed sugar pink with sludgy lime whiel Isabel Marant championed lilac and red. Jacket and jumper, all driesvannoten.com In the spotlightStand out from the crowd in headline accessories and statement outerwear. Fedora hat, wool cape, pinstripe waistcoat, blazer and trousers, sweater and Chelsea boots, all celine.com DenimDenim is back in a big way and a looser cut silhouette is best in show. Jacket, jeans, and large Jackie Hobo bag, all gucci.com. Model: Moussa at Supa Model Management; grooming and skincare preparation by Dina at the Creative Artists using DrIdriss.com; hair by Richard Scorer for Haringtons Hairdressing; fashion assistants Sam Deaman and Roz Donoghue; photographer’s assistant Marija Vainilaviciute
